Damn, this is rough. I'm sorry!
1. I would suggest not texting as much and talking via phone calls. It might sound kind of weird to only communicate with phone calls at first, but it is much more effective, and what is the point of communication that is only ineffective and makes you upset (ergo hurting the relationship)?
2. Therapy. :)
3. *Communication*. Work on communicating effectively **especially** when you are in an freaking out and all over the place. Take a few minutes to figure out your thoughts, breathe, figure things out. Stay calm when you are talking. Effective communication is a great thing that takes lots off work, but it sounds like you have a nice guy there is who willing to work through it.
tl;dr Way less texting, therapy :), with work slowly but surely communication gets better.

I normally cycle around a month of depression followed by a short hypomanic stage. It's pretty hard for me to cycle up just by random everyday events, but I can cycle down into depression nearly instantly.
Edit: To answer the question, a good nights sleep can help me recover from depression immensely. So does eating healthy and exercising. All three of those things help quickly, but have WAY less problems if I stay consistent with all three.
